channel.title: All website critiques tell me how good i did
channel.description:
Okay, So please spare all unnecessary rudeness. . . This is my first site i made completely by myself. :| Other websites i made i used pre-made. This isn't counting the forum, You can just ignore them if you wish :P.
Well tell me the good&bads about my site please<3 http://dev-x.co.nr PS. I made all the images too and i'm not a good gfx maker.

item.title: All website critiques tell me how good i did
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:17, topic:210547”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=277406.msg2261275#msg2261275 date=1212739905]
First of all, one of your logos is a bitmap, and you should never use bitmaps on the internet, convert it to jpg or something.[/quote]

The only problem with that, is jpg loses transparency.

Now, first, the images are poor quality, the grey boxes just stick out, as well as the text. It’s very basic, and I think you need to take a dictionary reference for ‘affiliate’.

The forum skin is terrible, too.

I suggest you take some time looking at some website templates, get the general theme of a website and reconstruct it, as for the forum skin, go for something a bit more calm. It’s not nice reading a forum with a high contrast skin.[/quote]

Well then, use .GIF or .PNG

@thread: Like everyone said, it’s too dark. Liven up the colors a bit

Read full topic
item.source: All website critiques tell me how good i did

item.title: All website critiques tell me how good i did
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

VB7 Rocks:

First of all, one of your logos is a bitmap, and you should never use bitmaps on the internet, convert it to jpg or something.

The only problem with that, is jpg loses transparency.

Now, first, the images are poor quality, the grey boxes just stick out, as well as the text. It’s very basic, and I think you need to take a dictionary reference for ‘affiliate’.

The forum skin is terrible, too.

I suggest you take some time looking at some website templates, get the general theme of a website and reconstruct it, as for the forum skin, go for something a bit more calm. It’s not nice reading a forum with a high contrast skin.

Read full topic
item.source: All website critiques tell me how good i did

item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

i think it’d look better with a 1px border on the navigation / content, and a slightly lighter backgroundcolor (see colour lovers for some nice palettes), also i prefer having a scroll-over effect for the links in the menu, but it’s not necessary

item.description:
@Got_Java wrote:

[quote=“quest rs, post:4, topic:210547”]The blue and grey look good actually but can give some readers problem, especially since it seems like you are going for a more casual layout instead of professional.

I like how its simple and plain but it maybe TOO simple, spice it up with some graphics :)[/quote]thanks, don’t worry i will
EDIT: Made text easier to read.

item.title: All website critiques tell me how good i did
item.dc:creator: @Got_Java Got Java?
item.description:
@Got_Java wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:2, topic:210547”]First of all, one of your logos is a bitmap, and you should never use bitmaps on the internet, convert it to jpg or something.

Second… The text is hard to read, dark blue on dark gray doesn’t really work that well.

And it’s kind of… Bland overall, I guess…

This is your first website that you’ve made, right? Keep working at it, you’ll get better. Don’t give up just because my review wasn’t so hot ;)[/quote]Okay, Thank you; Your feedback was highly appreciated

Read full topic

Second… The text is hard to read, dark blue on dark gray doesn’t really work that well.

And it’s kind of… Bland overall, I guess…

This is your first website that you’ve made, right? Keep working at it, you’ll get better. Don’t give up just because my review wasn’t so hot
